snippet: The deaths of three women opened up questions about whether the killings were linked to the long struggle for Kurdish autonomy in Turkey.
abstract: Murders of three Kurdish women in Paris open up questions about whether killings are linked to the long struggle for Kurdish autonomy in Turkey; one victim was founder of  Kurdish separatist group and other two were Kurdish activists; killings prompt outrage, raise fears of violent revenge and open new chapter in murky annals of Kurdish exile life.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Scott Sayare contributed reporting from Paris, and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The deaths of three women opened up questions about whether the killings were linked to the long struggle for Kurdish autonomy in Turkey.

headline.seo: Kurdish Killings in Paris, and Motive Is a Mystery
headline.main: 3 Kurds Are Killed in Paris, in Locked-Door Mystery
headline.print_headline: 3 Kurds Slain in Paris, in Locked-Door Mystery
